items.text:
Destroys the Component. This method must not be overridden.
To add extra functionality to destruction time in a subclass, implement the
template method {@link #method!beforeDestroy #beforeDestroy} or {@link #method!onDestroy #onDestroy}. And do not forget to
`callParent()` in your implementation.

items.name: didValueChange
items.text:
Checks if the value has changed. Allows subclasses to override for
any more complex logic.

items.name: disable
items.text: Disable the component.

items.name: silent
items.text: Passing `true` will suppress the `disable` event from being fired.

items.name: doAlign
items.text: Performs the alignment on the picker using the class defaults

items.name: doApplyRenderTpl
items.text:
Called from the selected frame generation template to insert this Component's inner structure inside the framing structure.

When framing is used, a selected frame generation template is used as the primary template of the #getElConfig instead
of the configured {@link Ext.Component#cfg!renderTpl Ext.Component#renderTpl}. The renderTpl is invoked by this method which is injected into the framing template.

items.name: doAutoRender
items.text:
Handles autoRender.
Floating Components may have an ownerCt. If they are asking to be constrained, constrain them within that
ownerCt, and have their z-index managed locally. Floating Components are always rendered to document.body

items.name: doConstrain
items.text:
Moves this floating Component into a constrain region.

By default, this Component is constrained to be within the container it was added to, or the element it was
rendered to.

An alternative constraint may be passed.

items.name: constrainTo
doFireDelegatedEvent
items.text:
Fires a delegated event.  Users should not invoke this method directly.  It
is called automatically by the framework as needed (see the "delegate" event
option of {@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener} for more
details.

items.name: doFireEvent
items.text: Continue to fire event.

items.name: enable
items.text: Enable the component

items.name: silent
items.text: Passing `true` will suppress the `enable` event from being fired.

items.name: enableBubble
eventNames
items.text: The event name to bubble, or an Array of event names.

items.name: ensureAttachedToBody
items.text:
Ensures that this component is attached to `document.body`. If the component was
rendered to {@link Ext#method!getDetachedBody Ext#getDetachedBody}, then it will be appended to `document.body`.
Any configured position is also restored.

items.name: runLayout
items.text: True to run the component's layout.

items.name: expand
items.text: Expands this field's picker dropdown.

items.name: extractFileInput
items.text:
Only relevant if the instance's {@link #method!isFileUpload #isFileUpload} method returns true. Returns a reference to the file input
DOM element holding the user's selected file. The input will be appended into the submission form and will not be
returned, so this method should also create a replacement.

items.name: findFocusTarget
items.text:
Finds an alternate Component to focus if this Component is disabled while focused, or
focused while disabled, or otherwise unable to focus.

In both cases, focus must not be lost to document.body, but must move to an intuitively
connectible Component, either a sibling, or uncle or nephew.

This is both for the convenience of keyboard users, and also for when focus is tracked
within a Component tree such as for ComboBoxes and their dropdowns.

For example, a ComboBox with a PagingToolbar in is BoundList. If the "Next Page"
button is hit, the LoadMask shows and focuses, the next page is the last page, so
the "Next Page" button is disabled. When the LoadMask hides, it attempt to focus the
last focused Component which is the disabled "Next Page" button. In this situation,
focus should move to a sibling within the PagingToolbar.
A closely related focusable Component to which focus can move.

items.name: findParentBy
items.text:
Find a container above this component at any level by a custom function. If the passed function returns true, the
container will be returned.

See also the {@link Ext.Component#method!up Ext.Component#up} method.

items.name: fn
items.text: The custom function to call with the arguments (container, this component).
The first Container for which the custom function returns true

items.name: findParentByType
items.text:
Find a container above this component at any level by xtype or class

See also the {@link Ext.Component#method!up Ext.Component#up} method.

items.name: xtype
items.text: The xtype string for a component, or the class of the component directly
The first Container which matches the given xtype or class

items.name: findPlugin
ptype
items.text:
The Plugin's `ptype` as specified by the class's
{@link Ext.Class#cfg!alias Ext.Class#cfg-alias} configuration.
plugin instance or `{@link undefined}` if not found

items.name: finishRender
items.text:
This method visits the rendered component tree in a "top-down" order. That is, this
code runs on a parent component before running on a child. This method calls the
{@link #method!onRender #onRender} method of each component.

items.name: containerIdx
items.text: The index into the Container items of this Component.

items.name: fireAction
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action).
By default, the action function will be executed after any "before" event handlers
(as specified using the `order` option of
`{@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener}`), but before any other
handlers are fired.  This gives the "before" handlers an opportunity to
cancel the event by returning `false`, and prevent the action function from
being called.

The action can also be configured to run after normal handlers, but before any "after"
handlers (as specified using the `order` event option) by passing `'after'`
as the `order` parameter.  This configuration gives any event handlers except
for "after" handlers the opportunity to cancel the event and prevent the action
function from being called.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: options
items.text:
Event options for the action function.  Accepts any
of the options of `{@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener}`

items.name: order
items.text:
The order to call the action function relative
too the event handlers (`'before'` or `'after'`).  Note that this option is
simply used to sort the action function relative to the event handlers by "priority".
An order of `'before'` is equivalent to a priority of `99.5`, while an order of
`'after'` is equivalent to a priority of `-99.5`.  See the `priority` option
of `{@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener}` for more details.

items.name: fireEvent
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameters (minus the event name, plus the `options` object passed
to {@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener}).

An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See {@link Ext.Component#method!getBubbleTarget Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget}) by
calling {@link #method!enableBubble #enableBubble}.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Variable number of parameters are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventArgs
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameter list.

An event may be set to bubble up an Observable parent hierarchy (See {@link Ext.Component#method!getBubbleTarget Ext.Component#getBubbleTarget}) by
calling {@link #method!enableBubble #enableBubble}.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: An array of parameters which are passed to handlers.
returns false if any of the handlers return false otherwise it returns true.

items.name: fireEventedAction
items.text:
Fires the specified event with the passed parameters and executes a function (action).
Evented Actions will automatically dispatch a 'before' event passing. This event will
be given a special controller that allows for pausing/resuming of the event flow.

By pausing the controller the updater and events will not run until resumed. Pausing,
however, will not stop the processing of any other before events.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to fire.

items.name: args
items.text: Arguments to pass to handlers and to the action function.

items.name: fn
items.text: The action function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the handler function is
executed. **If omitted, defaults to the object which fired the event.**

items.name: fnArgs
items.text:
Optional arguments for the action `fn`. If not
given, the normal `args` will be used to call `fn`. If `false` is passed, the
`args` are used but if the first argument is this instance it will be removed
from the args passed to the action function.

items.name: fireHierarchyEvent
items.text:
This method fires an event on `{@link Ext.GlobalEvents}` allowing interested parties to know
of certain critical events for this component. This is done globally because the
(few) listeners can immediately receive the event rather than bubbling the event
only to reach the top and have no listeners.

The main usage for these events is to do with floating components. For example, the
load mask is a floating component. The component it is masking may be inside several
containers. As such, they need to know when component is hidden, either directly, or
via a parent container being hidden. To do this they subscribe to these events and
filter out the appropriate container.

This functionality is contained in Component (as opposed to Container) because a
Component can be the ownerCt for a floating component (loadmask), and the loadmask
needs to know when its owner is shown/hidden so that its hidden state can be
synchronized.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The event name.

items.name: fixReference
items.text: Sets up a reference on our current reference holder.

items.name: focus
items.text:
Try to focus this component.

If this component is disabled, a close relation will be targeted for focus instead
to keep focus localized for keyboard users.

items.name: selectText
items.text: If applicable, `true` to also select all the text in this component, or an array consisting of start and end (defaults to start) position of selection.

items.name: delay
items.text: Delay the focus this number of milliseconds (true for 10 milliseconds).

items.name: callback
items.text: Only needed if the `delay` parameter is used. A function to call upon focus.

items.name: scope
items.text: Only needed if the `delay` parameter is used. The scope (`this` reference) in which to execute the callback.

The focused Component. Usually `this` Component. Some Containers may
delegate focus to a descendant Component ({@link Ext.window.Window}s can do this through their
{@link Ext.window.Window#cfg!defaultFocus Ext.window.Window#defaultFocus} config option. If this component is disabled, a closely
related component will be focused and that will be returned.

items.name: getActiveAnimation
items.text: Returns the current animation if this object has any effects actively running or queued, else returns false.
Anim if element has active effects, else false

items.name: getActiveError
items.text:
Gets the active error message for this component, if any. This does not trigger validation on its own, it merely
returns any message that the component may already hold.
The active error message on the component; if there is no error, an empty string is returned.

items.name: getActiveErrors
items.text:
Gets an Array of any active error messages currently applied to the field. This does not trigger validation on
its own, it merely returns any messages that the component may already hold.

The active error messages on the component; if there are no errors, an empty Array is
returned.

items.name: getAlignToXY
items.text:
Gets the x,y coordinates to align this element with another element. See
{@link #method!alignTo #alignTo} for more info on the supported position values.

items.name: element
items.text:
The Positionable,
HTMLElement, or id of the element to align to.

items.name: position
items.text: The position to align to

items.name: offsets
items.text: Offset the positioning by [x, y]
[x, y]

items.name: getAnchorToXY
items.text:
Gets the x,y coordinates of an element specified by the anchor position on the
element.

items.name: el
items.text: The element

items.name: anchor
items.text:
The specified anchor position.
See {@link #method!alignTo #alignTo} for details on supported anchor positions.

items.name: local
items.text:
True to get the local (element top/left-relative) anchor
position instead of page coordinates

items.name: size
items.text:
An object containing the size to use for calculating anchor
position {width: (target width), height: (target height)} (defaults to the
element's current size)
[x, y] An array containing the element's x and y coordinates

items.name: getAnchorXY
items.text: Gets the x,y coordinates specified by the anchor position on the element.

items.name: anchor
items.text:
The specified anchor position.
See {@link #method!alignTo #alignTo} for details on supported anchor positions.

items.name: local
items.text:
True to get the local (element top/left-relative) anchor
position instead of page coordinates

items.name: size
items.text:
An object containing the size to use for calculating anchor
position {width: (target width), height: (target height)} (defaults to the
element's current size)
[x, y] An array containing the element's x and y coordinates

items.name: getAnimationProps
items.text: Get animation properties

items.name: getAriaLabelEl
items.text:
Find component(s) that label or describe this component,
and return the id(s) of their ariaEl elements.

items.name: reference
items.text:
Component reference,
or array of component references, or a function that should return
the proper attribute string. The function will be called in the
context of the labelled component.
Element id string, or null

items.name: getBorderPadding
items.text: Returns the size of the element's borders and padding.

an object with the following numeric properties
- beforeX
- afterX
- beforeY
- afterY

items.name: getBox
items.text:
Return an object defining the area of this Element which can be passed to
{@link #method!setBox #setBox} to set another Element's size/location to match this element.

items.name: contentBox
items.text:
If true a box for the content of the element is
returned.

items.name: local
items.text:
If true the element's left and top relative to its
`offsetParent` are returned instead of page x/y.
An object in the format

items.name: x
items.text: The element's X position.

items.name: y
items.text: The element's Y position.

items.name: width
items.text: The element's width.

items.name: height
items.text: The element's height.

items.name: bottom
items.text: The element's lower bound.

items.name: right
items.text:
The element's rightmost bound.

The returned object may also be addressed as an Array where index 0 contains the X
position and index 1 contains the Y position. The result may also be used for
{@link #method!setXY #setXY}

items.name: getBubbleParent
items.text: Gets the bubbling parent for an Observable
The bubble parent. null is returned if no bubble target exists

items.name: getBubbleTarget
items.text:
Implements an upward event bubbling policy. By default a Component bubbles events up to its {@link #method!getRefOwner #getRefOwner}.

Component subclasses may implement a different bubbling strategy by overriding this method.

items.name: getClientRegion
items.text:
Returns a region object that defines the client area of this element.

That is, the area *within* any scrollbars.
A Region containing "top, left, bottom, right" properties.

items.name: getConfig
items.text:
Returns a specified config property value. If the name parameter is not passed,
all current configuration options will be returned as key value pairs.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the config property to get.

items.name: peek
items.text: `true` to peek at the raw value without calling the getter.
The config property value.

items.name: getConstrainRegion
items.text:
Returns the content region of this element for purposes of constraining floating
children.  That is the region within the borders and scrollbars, but not within the padding.

items.name: getConstrainVector
items.text:
Returns the `[X, Y]` vector by which this Positionable's element must be translated to make a best
attempt to constrain within the passed constraint. Returns `false` if the element
does not need to be moved.

Priority is given to constraining the top and left within the constraint.

The constraint may either be an existing element into which the element is to be
constrained, or a {@link Ext.util.Region} into which this element is to be
constrained.

By default, any extra shadow around the element is **not** included in the constrain calculations - the edges
of the element are used as the element bounds. To constrain the shadow within the constrain region, set the
`constrainShadow` property on this element to `true`.

items.name: constrainTo
items.text:
The
Positionable, HTMLElement, element id, or Region into which the element is to be
constrained.

items.name: proposedPosition
items.text:
A proposed `[X, Y]` position to test for validity
and to produce a vector for instead of using the element's current position

items.name: proposedSize
items.text:
A proposed `[width, height]` size to constrain
instead of using the element's current size

**If** the element *needs* to be translated, an `[X, Y]`
vector by which this element must be translated. Otherwise, `false`.

items.name: getController
items.text:
Returns the {@link Ext.app.ViewController} instance associated with this
component via the {@link #cfg!controller #controller} config or {@link #setController} method.

Returns this component's ViewController or
null if one was not configured

items.name: getEl
items.text: Retrieves the top level element representing this component.

items.name: getEmptyText
items.text: Returns the value of this field's {@link #cfg!emptyText #cfg-emptyText}
The value of this field's emptyText

items.name: getErrors
items.text:
Runs all of Date's validations and returns an array of any errors. Note that this first runs Text's validations,
so the returned array is an amalgamation of all field errors. The additional validation checks are testing that
the date format is valid, that the chosen date is within the min and max date constraints set, that the date
chosen is not in the disabledDates regex and that the day chosed is not one of the disabledDays.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to get errors for (defaults to the current field value)
All validation errors for this field

items.name: getFieldLabel
items.text:
Returns the label for the field. Defaults to simply returning the {@link #cfg!fieldLabel #fieldLabel} config. Can be overridden
to provide a custom generated label.
The configured field label, or empty string if not defined

items.name: getFocusClsEl
items.text:
Returns the focus styling holder element associated with this Focusable.
By default it is the same element as {@link #method!getFocusEl #getFocusEl}.
The focus styling element.

items.name: getFocusEl
items.text:
Returns the focus holder element associated with this Focusable. At the
level of the Focusable base, this function returns `this.el` (or for Widgets,
`this.element`).

Subclasses with embedded focusable elements (such as Window, Field and Button)
should override this for use by {@link Ext.util.Focusable#method!focus Ext.util.Focusable#method-focus}
method.

items.name: getFrameInfo
items.text:
On render, reads an encoded style attribute, "filter" from the style of this Component's element.
This information is memoized based upon the CSS class name of this Component's element.
Because child Components are rendered as textual HTML as part of the topmost Container, a dummy div is inserted
into the document to receive the document element's CSS class name, and therefore style attributes.

items.name: getHeight
items.text: Gets the current height of the component's underlying element.

items.name: getId
items.text: Retrieves the `{@link #cfg!id id}` of this component. Will auto-generate an `{@link #cfg!id id}` if one has not already been set.

items.name: getInherited
items.text: This method returns an object containing the inherited properties for this instance.

items.name: inner
items.text:
Pass `true` to return `inheritedStateInner` instead
of the normal `inheritedState` object. This is only needed internally and should
not be passed by user code.
The `inheritedState` object containing inherited properties.

items.name: getInheritedConfig
items.text:
This method returns the value of a config property that may be inherited from some
ancestor.

In some cases, a config may be explicitly set on a component with the intent of
*only* being presented to its children while that component should act upon the
inherited value (see `referenceHolder` for example). In these cases the `skipThis`
parameter should be specified as `true`.

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the config property to return.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
Pass `true` if the property should be ignored if
found on this instance. In other words, `true` means the property must be inherited
and not explicitly set on this instance.
The value of the requested `property`.

items.name: getInitialConfig
name
items.text: Name of the config option to return.

The full config object or a single config value
when `{@link #cfg!name name}` parameter specified.

items.name: getInputId
items.text:
Returns the input id for this field. If none was specified via the {@link #cfg!inputId #inputId} config, then an id will be
automatically generated.

items.name: getInsertPosition
items.text:
This function takes the position argument passed to onRender and returns a
DOM element that you can use in the insertBefore.

items.name: position
items.text:
Index, element id or element you want
to put this component before.
DOM element that you can use in the insertBefore

items.name: getItemId
items.text:
Returns the value of {@link #cfg!itemId #itemId} assigned to this component, or when that
is not set, returns the value of {@link #cfg!id #id}.

items.name: getLabelableRenderData
items.text: Generates the arguments for the field decorations {@link #cfg!labelableRenderTpl #labelableRenderTpl}.

items.name: data
items.text:
optional object to use as the base data object.  If provided,
this method will add properties to the base object instead of creating a new one.
The template arguments

items.name: getLoader
items.text: Gets the {@link Ext.ComponentLoader} for this Component.
The loader instance, null if it doesn't exist.

items.name: getLocalX
items.text: Returns the x coordinate of this element reletive to its `offsetParent`.
The local x coordinate

items.name: getLocalXY
items.text: Returns the x and y coordinates of this element relative to its `offsetParent`.
The local XY position of the element

items.name: getLocalY
items.text: Returns the y coordinate of this element reletive to its `offsetParent`.
The local y coordinate

items.name: getMaskTarget
items.text:
Returns the element which is masked by the {@link #method!mask #mask} method, or into which the {@link #method!setLoading #setLoading} is rendered into.

The default implementation uses the {@link #cfg!maskElement #maskElement} configuration to access the Component's child element by name. By default, {@link #cfg!maskElement #maskElement}
is `{@link null}` which means that `{@link null}` is returned from this method indicating that the mask needs to be rendered into the document because
component structure should not be contaminated by mask elements.

Some subclasses may override this method if they have knowledge about external structures where a mask could usefully be rendered.

For example a {@link Ext.view.Table} will request that its owning {@link Ext.panel.Table} be masked. The
GridPanel will have its own implementation of `{@link #method!getMaskTarget getMaskTarget}` which will return the element dictated by its own {@link #cfg!maskElement #maskElement}
Panels use `"el"` as their {@link #cfg!maskElement #maskElement} by default, but that could be overridden to be `"body"` to leave toolbars and the header
mouse-accessible.

items.name: getModelData
items.text:
Returns the value(s) that should be saved to the {@link Ext.data.Model} instance for this field, when {@link Ext.form.Basic#method!updateRecord Ext.form.Basic#updateRecord} is called. Typically this will be an object with a single name-value pair, the name
being this field's {@link #getName name} and the value being its current data value. More advanced field
implementations may return more than one name-value pair. The returned values will be saved to the corresponding
field names in the Model.

Note that the values returned from this method are not guaranteed to have been successfully {@link #method!validate #validate}.

A mapping of submit parameter names to values; each value should be a string, or an array of
strings if that particular name has multiple values. It can also return null if there are no parameters to be
submitted.

items.name: getName
items.text:
Returns the {@link Ext.form.field.Field#cfg!name Ext.form.field.Field#name} attribute of the field. This is used as the parameter name
when including the field value in a {@link Ext.form.Basic#method!submit Ext.form.Basic#submit}.
name The field {@link Ext.form.field.Field#cfg!name Ext.form.field.Field#name}

items.name: getOffsetsTo
items.text:
Returns the offsets of this element from the passed element. The element must both
be part of the DOM tree and not have display:none to have page coordinates.

items.name: offsetsTo
items.text:
The Positionable,
HTMLElement, or element id to get get the offsets from.
The XY page offsets (e.g. `[100, -200]`)

items.name: getOverflowEl
items.text: Get an el for overflowing, defaults to the target el

items.name: getOverflowStyle
items.text:
Returns the CSS style object which will set the Component's scroll styles.
This must be applied to the {@link #method!getTargetEl #getTargetEl}.

items.name: getPicker
items.text:
Returns a reference to the picker component for this field, creating it if necessary by
calling {@link #method!createPicker #createPicker}.
The picker component

items.name: getPlugin
pluginId
items.text: The `pluginId` set on the plugin config object
plugin instance or `{@link null}` if not found

items.name: getPlugins
items.text: Returns an array of current fully constructed plugin instances.

items.name: getPosition
items.text: Gets the current XY position of the component's underlying element.

items.name: local
items.text: If true the element's left and top are returned instead of page XY.
The XY position of the element (e.g., [100, 200])

items.name: getRawValue
items.text:
Returns the raw String value of the field, without performing any normalization, conversion, or validation. Gets
the current value of the input element if the field has been rendered, ignoring the value if it is the
{@link #cfg!emptyText #emptyText}. To get a normalized and converted value see {@link #method!getValue #getValue}.
The raw String value of the field

items.name: getRefItems
items.text:
The CQ interface. Allow drilling down into the picker when it exists.
Important for determining whether an event took place in the bounds of some
higher level containing component. See AbstractComponent#owns

items.name: getRefOwner
items.text:
Used by {@link Ext.ComponentQuery}, and the {@link Ext.Component#method!up Ext.Component#up}
method to find the owning Component in the linkage hierarchy.

By default this returns the Container which contains this Component.

This may be overridden by Component authors who implement ownership hierarchies
which are not based upon ownerCt, such as BoundLists being owned by Fields or Menus
being owned by Buttons.

items.name: getRegion
items.text: Returns a region object that defines the area of this element.
A Region containing "top, left, bottom, right" properties.

items.name: getScrollX
items.text:
Returns the "x" scroll position for this component.  Only applicable for
{@link #cfg!scrollable #scrollable} components

items.name: getScrollY
items.text:
Returns the "y" scroll position for this component.  Only applicable for
{@link #cfg!scrollable #scrollable} components

items.name: getSize
items.text: Gets the current size of the component's underlying element.

items.name: contentSize
items.text: true to get the width/size minus borders and padding
An object containing the element's size:

items.name: getSizeModel
items.text:
Returns an object that describes how this component's width and height are managed.
All of these objects are shared and should not be modified.
The size model for this component.

items.name: width
items.text:
The {@link Ext.layout.SizeModel}
for the width.

items.name: height
items.text:
The {@link Ext.layout.SizeModel}
for the height.

items.name: getState
items.text:
The supplied default state gathering method for the Component class.

This method returns dimension settings such as `{@link #cfg!flex flex}`, `{@link #cfg!anchor anchor}`, `{@link #cfg!width width}` and `{@link #cfg!height height}` along with `collapsed`
state.

Subclasses which implement more complex state should call the superclass's implementation, and apply their state
to the result if this basic state is to be saved.

Note that Component state will only be saved if the Component has a {@link #cfg!stateId #stateId} and there as a StateProvider
configured for the document.

items.name: getStateId
items.text: Gets the state id for this object.
The 'stateId' or the implicit 'id' specified by component configuration.

items.name: getStyleProxy
items.text:
Returns an offscreen div with the same class name as the element this is being rendered.
This is because child item rendering takes place in a detached div which, being not
part of the document, has no styling.

items.name: getSubmitData
items.text: Private override to use getSubmitValue() as a convenience

items.name: getSubTplData
items.text: Creates and returns the data object to be used when rendering the {@link #cfg!fieldSubTpl #fieldSubTpl}.
The template data

items.name: getSubTplMarkup
items.text: Gets the markup to be inserted into the outer template's bodyEl. For fields this is the actual input element.

items.name: getTabIndex
items.text: Return the actual tabIndex for this Focusable.
tabIndex attribute value

items.name: getTargetEl
items.text: This is used to determine where to insert the 'html', 'contentEl' and 'items' in this component.

items.name: getTdCls
items.text: Needed for when widget is rendered into a grid cell. The class to add to the cell element.

items.name: getTrigger
items.text: Returns the trigger with the given id

items.name: getValue
items.text:
Returns the current data value of the field. The type of value returned is particular to the type of the
particular field (e.g. a Date object for {@link Ext.form.field.Date}), as the result of calling {@link #method!rawToValue #rawToValue} on
the field's {@link #method!processRawValue #processRawValue} String value. To return the raw String value, see {@link #method!getRawValue #getRawValue}.
value The field value

items.name: getViewRegion
items.text:
Returns the **content** region of this element. That is the region within the borders
and padding.
A Region containing "top, left, bottom, right" member data.

items.name: getWidth
items.text: Gets the current width of the component's underlying element.

items.name: getX
items.text: Gets the current X position of the DOM element based on page coordinates.
The X position of the element

items.name: getXType
items.text:
Gets the xtype for this component as registered with {@link Ext.ComponentManager}. For a list of all available
xtypes, see the {@link Ext.Component} header. Example usage:

    var t = new Ext.form.field.Text();
    alert(t.getXType());  // alerts 'textfield'
The xtype

items.name: getXTypes
items.text:
Returns this Component's xtype hierarchy as a slash-delimited string. For a list of all available xtypes, see the
{@link Ext.Component} header.

**If using your own subclasses, be aware that a Component must register its own xtype to participate in
determination of inherited xtypes.**

Example usage:

    @example
    var t = new Ext.form.field.Text();
    alert(t.getXTypes());  // alerts 'component/field/textfield'
The xtype hierarchy string

items.name: getXY
items.text: Gets the current position of the DOM element based on page coordinates.
The XY position of the element

items.name: getY
items.text: Gets the current Y position of the DOM element based on page coordinates.
The Y position of the element

items.name: hasActiveError
items.text:
Tells whether the field currently has an active error message. This does not trigger validation on its own, it
merely looks for any message that the component may already hold.

items.name: hasCls
items.text: Checks if the specified CSS class exists on this element's DOM node.

items.name: className
items.text: The CSS class to check for.
`true` if the class exists, else `false`.

items.name: hasListener
items.text:
Checks to see if this object has any listeners for a specified event, or whether the event bubbles. The answer
indicates whether the event needs firing or not.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to check for
`true` if the event is being listened for or bubbles, else `false`

items.name: hasOwnProperty
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

Returns true if object contains specified property; else
returns false.

items.name: hasUICls
items.text: Checks if there is currently a specified `{@link #cfg!uiCls uiCls}`.

items.name: cls
items.text: The `{@link #cfg!cls cls}` to check.

items.name: hasVisibleLabel
items.text: Checks if the field has a visible label
True if the field has a visible label

items.name: hide
items.text: Hides this Component, setting it to invisible using the configured {@link #cfg!hideMode #hideMode}.

items.name: animateTarget
items.text:
**only valid for {@link #cfg!floating #cfg-floating} Components
such as {@link Ext.window.Window}s or {@link Ext.tip.ToolTip}s, or regular Components which have
been configured with `floating: true`.**. The target to which the Component should animate while hiding.

items.name: callback
items.text: A callback function to call after the Component is hidden.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which the callback is executed.
Defaults to this Component.
this

items.name: initBindable
items.text:
This method triggers the lazy configs and must be called when it is time to
fully boot up. The configs that must be initialized are: `{@link #cfg!bind bind}`, `{@link #cfg!publishes publishes}`,
`{@link #cfg!session session}`, `{@link #cfg!twoWayBindable twoWayBindable}` and `{@link #cfg!viewModel viewModel}`.

items.name: initComponent
initConfig

items.text: this

items.name: initEvents
items.text: Initialize any events on this component

items.name: initField
items.text:
Initializes this Field mixin on the current instance. Components using this mixin should call this method during
their own initialization process.

items.name: initFocusableElement
items.text:
Sets up the focus listener on this Component's {@link #method!getFocusEl #getFocusEl} if it has one.

Form Components which must implicitly participate in tabbing order usually have a naturally
focusable element as their {@link #method!getFocusEl #getFocusEl}, and it is the DOM event of that
receiving focus which drives the Component's `{@link #method!onFocus onFocus}` handling, and the DOM event of it
being blurred which drives the `{@link #method!onBlur onBlur}` handling.

items.name: initFocusableEvents
items.text:
Template method to do any event listener initialization for a Focusable.
This generally happens after the focusEl is available.

items.name: initInheritedState
items.text:
Called by `{@link #method!getInherited getInherited}` to initialize the inheritedState the first time it is
requested.

items.name: initLabelable
items.text:
Performs initialization of this mixin. Component classes using this mixin should call this method during their
own initialization.

items.name: initPadding
items.text:
Initializes padding by applying it to the target element, or if the layout manages
padding ensures that the padding on the target element is "0".

items.name: initRenderData
items.text: Initialized the renderData to be used when rendering the renderTpl.
Object with keys and values that are going to be applied to the renderTpl

items.name: initRenderTpl
items.text: Initializes the renderTpl.
The renderTpl XTemplate instance.

items.name: initState
items.text: Initializes the state of the object upon construction.

items.name: initStyles
items.text:
Applies padding, margin, border, top, left, height, and width configs to the
appropriate elements.

items.name: initValue
items.text: Initializes the field's value based on the initial config.

items.name: invalidateInheritedState
items.text:
This method marks the current inherited state as invalid. The next time a call is
made to `{@link #method!getInherited getInherited}` the objects will be recreated and initialized.

items.name: invokeTriggers
items.text: Invokes a method on all triggers.

items.name: is
items.text:
Tests whether this Component matches a {@link Ext.ComponentQuery}
selector string.

items.name: selector
items.text: The selector string to test against.
`true` if this Component matches the selector.

items.name: isAncestor
items.text:
Determines whether **this Component** is an ancestor of the passed Component.
This will return `true` if the passed Component is anywhere within the subtree
beneath this Component.

items.name: possibleDescendant
items.text:
The Component to test for presence
within this Component's subtree.

items.name: isDescendantOf
items.text: Determines whether this component is the descendant of a passed component.

items.name: ancestor
items.text: A Component which may contain this Component.
`true` if the component is the descendant of the passed component, otherwise `false`.

items.name: isDirty
items.text:
Returns true if the value of this Field has been changed from its {@link #property!originalValue #originalValue}.
Will always return false if the field is disabled.

Note that if the owning {@link Ext.form.Basic} was configured with
{@link Ext.form.Basic#cfg!trackResetOnLoad Ext.form.Basic#trackResetOnLoad} then the {@link #property!originalValue #originalValue} is updated when
the values are loaded by {@link Ext.form.Basic}.{@link Ext.form.Basic#method!setValues Ext.form.Basic#setValues}.

True if this field has been changed from its original value (and is not disabled),
false otherwise.

items.name: isDisabled
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is currently disabled.
the disabled state of this Component.

items.name: isDraggable
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is draggable.
the draggable state of this component.

items.name: isDroppable
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is droppable.
the droppable state of this component.

items.name: isEqual
items.text: Treat undefined and null values as equal to an empty string value.

items.name: isEqualAsString
items.text:
Returns whether two values are logically equal.
Similar to {@link #method!isEqual #isEqual}, however null or undefined values will be treated as empty strings.

items.name: value1
items.text: The first value to compare

items.name: value2
items.text: The second value to compare
True if the values are equal, false if inequal.

items.name: isFileUpload
items.text:
Returns whether this Field is a file upload field; if it returns true, forms will use special techniques for
{@link Ext.form.Basic#method!submit Ext.form.Basic#submit} via AJAX. See {@link Ext.form.Basic#method!hasUpload Ext.form.Basic#hasUpload} for details. If
this returns true, the {@link #method!extractFileInput #extractFileInput} method must also be implemented to return the corresponding file
input element.

items.name: isFloating
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is floating.
the floating state of this component.

items.name: isFocusable
items.text:
Determine if this Focusable can receive focus at this time.

Note that Containers can be non-focusable themselves while delegating
focus treatment to a child Component; see
{@link Ext.container.Container} for more information.

items.name: deep
items.text:
Optionally determine if the container itself
is focusable, or if container's focus is delegated to a child component
and that child is focusable.
True if component is focusable, false if not.

items.name: isHidden
items.text: Method to determine whether this Component is currently set to hidden.
the hidden state of this Component.

items.name: isLayoutChild
items.text:
Checks if this component will be contained by the passed component as part of its
layout run. If `true`, then the layout on `this` can be skipped because it will be
encompassed when the layout for `comp` runs. Typical cases where this may be be `false`
is when asking about floaters nested in containers.

items.name: comp
items.text: The potential owner.
`true` if this component is a layout child of `comp`.

items.name: isLayoutRoot
items.text:
Determines whether this Component is the root of a layout. This returns `true` if
this component can run its layout without assistance from or impact on its owner.
If this component cannot run its layout given these restrictions, `false` is returned
and its owner will be considered as the next candidate for the layout root.

Setting the {@link #property!_isLayoutRoot #_isLayoutRoot} property to `true` causes this method to always
return `true`. This may be useful when updating a layout of a Container which shrink
wraps content, and you know that it will not change size, and so can safely be the
topmost participant in the layout run.

items.name: isLayoutSuspended
items.text:
Returns `true` if layout is suspended for this component. This can come from direct
suspension of this component's layout activity ({@link Ext.container.Container#cfg!suspendLayout Ext.Container#suspendLayout}) or if one
of this component's containers is suspended.
`true` layout of this component is suspended.

items.name: isMasked
items.text: Returns masked state for this Component.

items.name: deep
items.text: True to look up this Component's parent masked state.
True if masked, false otherwise.

items.name: isPrototypeOf
prototype
items.text:
an object to be tested against each link in the prototype chain of the
*object* argument

items.name: object
items.text: the object whose prototype chain will be searched
Returns true if object is a prototype and false if not.

items.name: isSuspended
items.text: Checks if all events, or a specific event, is suspended.

items.name: event
items.text: The name of the specific event to check
`true` if events are suspended

items.name: isSyncing
items.text: Checks if a particular binding is synchronizing the value.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the property being bound to.
`true` if the binding is syncing.

items.name: isValid
items.text:
Returns whether or not the field value is currently valid by {@link #method!getErrors #getErrors} the
{@link #method!processRawValue #processRawValue} of the field. **Note**: {@link #cfg!disabled #disabled} fields are
always treated as valid.
True if the value is valid, else false

items.name: isVisible
items.text: Returns `true` if this component is visible.

items.name: deep
items.text:
Pass `true` to interrogate the visibility status of all parent Containers to
determine whether this Component is truly visible to the user.

Generally, to determine whether a Component is hidden, the no argument form is needed. For example when creating
dynamically laid out UIs in a hidden Container before showing them.
`true` if this component is visible, `false` otherwise.

items.name: isXType
items.text:
Tests whether or not this Component is of a specific xtype. This can test whether this Component is descended
from the xtype (default) or whether it is directly of the xtype specified (`shallow = true`).

**If using your own subclasses, be aware that a Component must register its own xtype to participate in
determination of inherited xtypes.**

For a list of all available xtypes, see the {@link Ext.Component} header.

Example usage:

    @example
    var t = new Ext.form.field.Text();
    var isText = t.isXType('textfield');        // true
    var isBoxSubclass = t.isXType('field');       // true, descended from Ext.form.field.Base
    var isBoxInstance = t.isXType('field', true); // false, not a direct Ext.form.field.Base instance

items.name: xtype
items.text: The xtype to check for this Component

items.name: shallow
items.text:
`true` to check whether this Component is directly of the specified xtype, `false` to
check whether this Component is descended from the xtype.
`true` if this component descends from the specified xtype, `false` otherwise.

items.name: link
items.text:
Adds a "destroyable" object to an internal list of objects that will be destroyed
when this instance is destroyed (via `{@link #destroy}`).
The `{@link #cfg!value value}` passed.

items.name: lookupController
items.text:
Gets the controller that controls this view. May be a controller that belongs
to a view higher in the hierarchy.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
`true` to not consider the controller directly attached
to this view (if it exists).
The controller. `{@link null}` if no controller is found.

items.name: lookupReferenceHolder
items.text: Gets the Controller or Component that is used as the reference holder for this view.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
`false` to return this as the reference holder if
this instance has set `referenceHolder`. Unlike `{@link #method!getInheritedConfig getInheritedConfig}` this method
defaults to `true` because it is possible that a `{@link #cfg!reference reference}` property set by the
owner of a component that is also a `referenceHolder` itself. In this case, the
`{@link #cfg!reference reference}` connects not to this component but to the parent referenceHolder.
The reference holder.

items.name: lookupSession
items.text:
Returns the `{@link Ext.data.Session}` for this instance. This property may come
from this instance's `{@link #cfg!session #session}` or be inherited from this object's parent.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
Pass `true` to ignore a `{@link #cfg!session session}` configured on
this instance and only consider an inherited session.

items.name: lookupViewModel
items.text:
Returns the `{@link Ext.app.ViewModel}` for this instance. This property may come from this
this instance's `{@link #cfg!viewModel #viewModel}` or be inherited from this object's parent.

items.name: skipThis
items.text:
Pass `true` to ignore a `{@link #cfg!viewModel viewModel}` configured on
this instance and only consider an inherited view model.

items.name: makeBindableUpdater
items.text:
Returns an `{@link #method!update update}` method for the given Config that will call `{@link #method!publishState #publishState}`
to ensure two-way bindings (via `{@link #cfg!bind bind}`) as well as any `{@link #cfg!publishes publishes}` are updated.
This method is cached on the `cfg` instance for re-use.
The updater function.

items.name: mask
items.text:
Masks this component with a semi-opaque layer and makes the contents unavailable to clicks.

See {@link #method!unmask #unmask}.

items.name: msg
items.text: A message to show in the center of the mask layer.

items.name: msgCls
items.text: A CSS class name to use on the message element in the center of the layer.

items.name: mon
items.text: Shorthand for {@link #method!addManagedListener #addManagedListener}.

items.name: move
items.text: Move the element relative to its current position.

items.name: direction
items.text:
Possible values are:

- `"l"` (or `"left"`)
- `"r"` (or `"right"`)
- `"t"` (or `"top"`, or `"up"`)
- `"b"` (or `"bottom"`, or `"down"`)

items.name: distance
items.text: How far to move the element in pixels

items.name: mun
items.text: Shorthand for {@link #method!removeManagedListener #removeManagedListener}.

items.name: nextNode
items.text:
Returns the next node in the Component tree in tree traversal order.

Note that this is not limited to siblings, and if invoked upon a node with no matching siblings, will walk the
tree to attempt to find a match. Contrast with {@link #method!nextSibling #nextSibling}.

items.name: selector
items.text: A {@link Ext.ComponentQuery} selector to filter the following nodes.

The next node (or the next node which matches the selector).
Returns `{@link null}` if there is no matching node.

items.name: nextSibling
items.text:
Returns the next sibling of this Component.

Optionally selects the next sibling which matches the passed {@link Ext.ComponentQuery} selector.

May also be referred to as **`next()`**

Note that this is limited to siblings, and if no siblings of the item match, `{@link null}` is returned. Contrast with
{@link #method!nextNode #nextNode}

items.name: selector
items.text: A {@link Ext.ComponentQuery} selector to filter the following items.

The next sibling (or the next sibling which matches the selector).
Returns `{@link null}` if there is no matching sibling.

items.name: onAdded
items.text:
Method to manage awareness of when components are added to their
respective Container, firing an #added event. References are
established at add time rather than at render time.

Allows addition of behavior when a Component is added to a
Container. At this stage, the Component is in the parent
Container's collection of child items. After calling the
superclass's `{@link #method!onAdded onAdded}`, the `{@link #property!ownerCt ownerCt}` reference will be present,
and if configured with a ref, the `refOwner` will be set.

items.name: container
items.text: Container which holds the component.

items.name: pos
items.text: Position at which the component was added.

items.name: instanced
items.text:
`false` if this component was instanced by the parent
container. `true` if the instance already existed when it was passed to the container.

items.name: onAfter
items.text:
Appends an after-event handler.

Same as {@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener} with `order` set
to `'after'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onBefore
items.text:
Appends a before-event handler.  Returning `false` from the handler will stop the event.

Same as {@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener} with `order` set
to `'before'`.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The name of the event to listen for.

items.name: fn
items.text: The method the event invokes.

items.name: scope
items.text: The scope for `fn`.

items.name: options
items.text: An object containing handler configuration.

items.name: onBoxReady
items.text:
Invoked when this component has first achieved size. Occurs after the
{@link #cfg!componentLayout #componentLayout} has completed its initial run.

This method is not called on components that use {@link #cfg!liquidLayout #liquidLayout}, such as
{@link Ext.button.Button} and {@link Ext.form.field.Base}.

**Note:** If the Component has a {@link Ext.Component#cfg!controller Ext.Component#controller}
and the controller has a {@link Ext.app.ViewController#method!boxReady Ext.app.ViewController#boxReady} method
it will be called passing the Component as the single param.

items.name: width
items.text: The width of this component

items.name: height
items.text: The height of this component

items.name: onChange
items.text: If grow=true, invoke the autoSize method when the field's value is changed.

items.name: onDestroy
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the destroy operation.
After calling the superclass's onDestroy, the Component will be destroyed.

items.name: onDirtyChange
items.text: Called when the field's dirty state changes. Adds/removes the {@link #cfg!dirtyCls #dirtyCls} on the main element.

items.name: onDisable
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the disable operation.
After calling the superclass's `{@link #method!onDisable onDisable}`, the Component will be disabled.

items.name: onEnable
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the enable operation.
After calling the superclass's `{@link #method!onEnable onEnable}`, the Component will be enabled.

items.name: onExpand
items.text: Sets the Date picker's value to match the current field value when expanding.

items.name: onFieldMutation
items.text:
Called when some event (See the checkChangeEvents property) mutates the input field.
We react to changes.

Subclasses may provide an inplementation which may perform other tasks (eg ComboBox value matching)
before calling the checkChange method.

items.name: onFocusEnter
items.text: Called when focus enters this Component's hierarchy

items.name: event
items.text: The underlying DOM event.

items.name: target
items.text: The element gaining focus.

items.name: relatedTarget
items.text: The element losing focus.

items.name: toComponent
items.text: The Component gaining focus.

items.name: fromComponent
items.text: The Component losing focus.

items.name: onFocusLeave
items.text: Called when focus exits from this Component's hierarchy

items.name: event
items.text: The underlying DOM event.

items.name: target
items.text: The element gaining focus.

items.name: relatedTarget
items.text: The element losing focus.

items.name: toComponent
items.text: The Component gaining focus.

items.name: fromComponent
items.text: The Component losing focus.

items.name: onHide
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the hide operation. After
calling the superclass's onHide, the Component will be hidden.

Gets passed the same parameters as #hide.

items.name: onInheritedAdd
items.text: Called when this Inheritable is added to a parent

items.name: onInheritedRemove
items.text: Called when this inheritable is removed from a parent

items.name: destroying
items.text: `true` if this item will be destroyed by it's container

items.name: onMouseDown
items.text:
Mousedown brings to front, and programmatically grabs focus
unless the mousedown was on a focusable element

items.name: onPosition
items.text:
Called after the component is moved, this method is empty by default but can be implemented by any
subclass that needs to perform custom logic after a move occurs.

items.name: x
items.text: The new x position.

items.name: y
items.text: The new y position.

items.name: onRemoved
items.text:
Method to manage awareness of when components are removed from their
respective Container, firing a #removed event. References are properly
cleaned up after removing a component from its owning container.

Allows addition of behavior when a Component is removed from
its parent Container. At this stage, the Component has been
removed from its parent Container's collection of child items,
but has not been destroyed (It will be destroyed if the parent
Container's `autoDestroy` is `true`, or if the remove call was
passed a truthy second parameter). After calling the
superclass's `{@link #method!onRemoved onRemoved}`, the `{@link #property!ownerCt ownerCt}` and the `refOwner` will not
be present.

items.name: destroying
items.text:
Will be passed as `true` if the Container performing the remove operation will delete this
Component upon remove.

items.name: onRender
items.text:
Template method called when this Component's DOM structure is created.

At this point, this Component's (and all descendants') DOM structure *exists* but it has not
been layed out (positioned and sized).

Subclasses which override this to gain access to the structure at render time should
call the parent class's method before attempting to access any child elements of the Component.

items.name: parentNode
items.text: The parent Element in which this Component's encapsulating element is contained.

items.name: containerIdx
items.text: The index within the parent Container's child collection of this Component.

items.name: onResize
items.text:
Called when the component is resized.

This method is not called on components that use {@link #cfg!liquidLayout #liquidLayout}, such as
{@link Ext.button.Button} and {@link Ext.form.field.Base}.

items.name: onScrollEnd
items.text: Invoked when a scroll operation is completed via this component's {@link #cfg!scrollable #scrollable}.

items.name: x
items.text: The current x position

items.name: y
items.text: The current y position

items.name: onScrollMove
items.text: Invoked when this component is scrolled via its {@link #cfg!scrollable #scrollable}.

items.name: x
items.text: The current x position

items.name: y
items.text: The current y position

items.name: onScrollStart
items.text: Invoked when a scroll is initiated on this component via its {@link #cfg!scrollable #scrollable}.

items.name: x
items.text: The current x position

items.name: y
items.text: The current y position

items.name: onShow
items.text:
Allows addition of behavior to the show operation. After
calling the superclass's onShow, the Component will be visible.

Override in subclasses where more complex behaviour is needed.

Gets passed the same parameters as #show.

items.name: onShowComplete
items.text:
Invoked after the #afterShow method is complete.

Gets passed the same `callback` and `scope` parameters that #afterShow received.

items.name: onStateChange
items.text: This method is called when any of the {@link #cfg!stateEvents #stateEvents} are fired.

items.name: onTriggerClick
items.text: Handles the trigger click; by default toggles between expanding and collapsing the picker component.

items.name: owns
items.text:
Returns `true` if the passed element is within the container tree of this component.

For example if a menu's submenu contains an {@link Ext.form.field.Date}, that top level
menu owns the elements of the date picker. Using this method, you can tell if an event took place
within a certain component tree.

items.name: postBlur
items.text: Template method to do any post-blur processing.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object

items.name: postFocus
items.text: Template method to do any post-focus processing.

items.name: e
items.text: The event object

items.name: previousNode
items.text:
Returns the previous node in the Component tree in tree traversal order.

Note that this is not limited to siblings, and if invoked upon a node with no matching siblings, will walk the
tree in reverse order to attempt to find a match. Contrast with {@link #method!previousSibling #previousSibling}.

items.name: selector
items.text: A {@link Ext.ComponentQuery} selector to filter the preceding nodes.

The previous node (or the previous node which matches the selector).
Returns `{@link null}` if there is no matching node.

items.name: previousSibling
selector
items.text: A {@link Ext.ComponentQuery} selector to filter the preceding items.

The previous sibling (or the previous sibling which matches the selector).
Returns `{@link null}` if there is no matching sibling.

items.name: processRawValue
value
items.text: The unprocessed string value
The processed string value

items.name: propertyIsEnumerable
prop
items.text: The name of the property to test.

If the object does not have the specified property, this
method returns false.

items.name: publishState
items.text:
Publish this components state to the `ViewModel`. If no arguments are given (or if
this is the first call), the entire state is published. This state is determined by
the `{@link #cfg!publishes publishes}` property.

This method is called only by component authors.

items.name: property
items.text: The name of the property to update.

items.name: value
items.text: The value of `property`. Only needed if `property` is given.

items.name: publishValue
items.text: Publish the value of this field.

items.name: rawToValue
items.text:
Converts a raw input field value into a mixed-type value that is suitable for this particular field type. This
allows controlling the normalization and conversion of user-entered values into field-type-appropriate values,
e.g. a Date object for {@link Ext.form.field.Date}, and is invoked by {@link #method!getValue #getValue}.

It is up to individual implementations to decide how to handle raw values that cannot be successfully converted
to the desired object type.

See {@link #method!valueToRaw #valueToRaw} for the opposite conversion.

The base implementation does no conversion, returning the raw value untouched.
The converted value.

items.name: refreshScroll
items.text:
Implementation which updates the scroll range of a touch scroller.
Subclasses may change implementation.

items.name: registerFloatingItem
items.text:
Called by Component#doAutoRender

Register a Container configured `floating: true` with this Component's {@link Ext.ZIndexManager}.

Components added in this way will not participate in any layout, but will be rendered
upon first show in the way that {@link Ext.window.Window}s are.

items.name: relayEvents
items.text:
Relays selected events from the specified Observable as if the events were fired by `this`.

For example if you are extending Grid, you might decide to forward some events from store.
So you can do this inside your initComponent:

    this.relayEvents(this.getStore(), ['load']);

The grid instance will then have an observable 'load' event which will be passed
the parameters of the store's load event and any function fired with the grid's
load event would have access to the grid using the this keyword (unless the event
is handled by a controller's control/listen event listener in which case 'this'
will be the controller rather than the grid).

items.name: origin
items.text: The Observable whose events this object is to relay.

items.name: events
items.text:
Array of event names to relay or an Object with key/value
pairs translating to ActualEventName/NewEventName respectively. For example:
    this.relayEvents(this, {add:'push', remove:'pop'});

Would now redispatch the add event of this as a push event and the remove event as a pop event.

items.name: prefix
removeAfterListener
items.text: Alias for {@link #method!unAfter #unAfter}.

items.name: removeBeforeListener
items.text: Alias for {@link #method!unBefore #unBefore}.

items.name: removeCls
items.text: Removes a CSS class from the top level element representing this component.

items.name: cls
items.text: The CSS class name to remove.
Returns the Component to allow method chaining.

items.name: removeClsWithUI
items.text:
Removes a `{@link #cfg!cls cls}` to the `{@link #cfg!uiCls uiCls}` array, which will also call {@link #method!removeUIClsFromElement #removeUIClsFromElement} and removes it from all
elements of this component.

items.name: cls
items.text: A string or an array of strings to remove to the `{@link #cfg!uiCls uiCls}`.

items.name: removeDelegatedListener
items.text:
Removes delegated listeners for a given eventName, function, and scope.
Users should not invoke this method directly.  It is called automatically by
the framework as part of {@link #method!removeListener #removeListener} processing.

items.name: removeListener
items.text: Removes an event handler.

items.name: eventName
items.text: The type of event the handler was associated with.

items.name: fn
items.text:
The handler to remove. **This must be a reference to the function
passed into the
{@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener} call.**

items.name: scope
removeManagedListener
items.text: Removes listeners that were added by the {@link #method!mon #mon} method.

items.name: item
items.text: The item from which to remove a listener/listeners.

items.name: ename
items.text: The event name, or an object containing event name properties.

items.name: fn
items.text: (optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the handler function.

items.name: scope
items.text:
(optional) If the `ename` parameter was an event name, this is the scope (`this` reference)
in which the handler function is executed.

items.name: removeManagedListenerItem
items.text: Remove a single managed listener item

items.name: isClear
items.text: True if this is being called during a clear

items.name: managedListener
items.text:
The managed listener item
See removeManagedListener for other args

items.name: removeUIClsFromElement
items.text:
Method which removes a specified UI + `{@link #cfg!uiCls uiCls}` from the components element. The `{@link #cfg!cls cls}`
which is added to the element will be: `this.baseCls + '-' + ui + uiCls`.

items.name: uiCls
items.text: The UI class to remove from the element.

items.name: removeUIFromElement
items.text: Method which removes a specified UI from the components element.

items.name: render
items.text:
Renders the Component into the passed HTML element.

**If you are using a {@link Ext.container.Container} object to house this
Component, then do not use the render method.**

A Container's child Components are rendered by that Container's
{@link Ext.container.Container#cfg!layout Ext.container.Container#layout} manager when the Container is first rendered.

When creating complex UIs, it is important to remember that sizing and positioning
of child items is the responsibility of the Container's {@link Ext.container.Container#cfg!layout Ext.container.Container#layout}
manager.  If you expect child items to be sized in response to user interactions, you must
configure the Container with a layout manager which creates and manages the type of layout you
have in mind.

**Omitting the Container's {@link Ext.container.Container#cfg!layout Ext.Container#layout} config means that a basic
layout manager is used which does nothing but render child components sequentially into the
Container. No sizing or positioning will be performed in this situation.**

items.name: container
items.text:
The element this Component should be
rendered into. If it is being created from existing markup, this should be omitted.

items.name: position
items.text:
The element ID or DOM node index within the container **before**
which this component will be inserted (defaults to appending to the end of the container)

items.name: renderActiveError
items.text:
Overrides the method from the Ext.form.Labelable mixin to also add the invalidCls to the inputEl,
as that is required for proper styling in IE with nested fields (due to lack of child selector)

items.name: reset
items.text:
Resets the current field value to the originally-loaded value and clears any validation messages.
Also adds **{@link #cfg!emptyText #emptyText}** and **{@link #cfg!emptyCls #emptyCls}** if the original value was blank.

items.name: resetOriginalValue
items.text:
Resets the field's {@link #property!originalValue #originalValue} property so it matches the current {@link #method!getValue #getValue}. This is
called by {@link Ext.form.Basic}.{@link Ext.form.Basic#method!setValues Ext.form.Basic#setValues} if the form's
{@link Ext.form.Basic#cfg!trackResetOnLoad Ext.form.Basic#trackResetOnLoad} property is set to true.

items.name: resolveListenerScope
items.text: Gets the Controller or Component that is used as the event root for this view.

items.name: defaultScope
items.text: The default scope to return if none is found.
The default listener scope.

items.name: resolveSatelliteListenerScope
items.text:
Returns the default listener scope for a "satellite" of this component.
Used for resolving scope for observable objects that are not part of the normal
Container/Component hierarchy (for example, plugins)
The listener scope

items.name: resumeEvent
items.text:
Resumes firing of the named event(s).

After calling this method to resume events, the events will fire when requested to fire.

**Note that if the {@link #method!suspendEvent #suspendEvent} method is called multiple times for a certain event,
this converse method will have to be called the same number of times for it to resume firing.**

items.name: eventName
items.text: Multiple event names to resume.

items.name: resumeEvents
items.text:
Resumes firing events (see {@link #method!suspendEvents #suspendEvents}).

If events were suspended using the `queueSuspended` parameter, then all events fired
during event suspension will be sent to any listeners now.

items.name: discardQueue
items.text:
`true` to prevent any previously queued events from firing
while we were suspended. See {@link #method!suspendEvents #suspendEvents}.

items.name: reverseTranslateXY
items.text: Converts local coordinates into page-level coordinates

items.name: xy
items.text: The local x and y coordinates
The translated coordinates

items.name: revertFocus
items.text:
Returns focus to the cached previously focused Component or element.

Usually called by onHide.

items.name: safeParse
items.text: Attempts to parse a given string value using a given {@link Ext.Date#method!parse Ext.Date#parse}.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to attempt to parse

items.name: format
items.text: A valid date format (see {@link Ext.Date#method!parse Ext.Date#parse})
The parsed Date object, or null if the value could not be successfully parsed.

items.name: savePropsToState
items.text:
Gathers additional named properties of the instance and adds their current values
to the passed state object.

items.name: propNames
items.text: The name (or array of names) of the property to save.

items.name: state
items.text: The state object in to which to save the property values.
state

items.name: savePropToState
items.text:
Conditionally saves a single property from this object to the given state object.
The idea is to only save state which has changed from the initial state so that
current software settings do not override future software settings. Only those
values that are user-changed state should be saved.

items.name: propName
items.text: The name of the property to save.

items.name: state
items.text: The state object in to which to save the property.

items.name: stateName
items.text: (optional) The name to use for the property in state.
True if the property was saved, false if not.

items.name: saveState
items.text: Saves the state of the object to the persistence store.

items.name: scrollBy
deltaX
items.text:
Either the x delta, an Array specifying x and y deltas or
an object with "x" and "y" properties.

items.name: deltaY
items.text: Either the y delta, or an animate flag or config object.

items.name: animate
items.text: Animate flag/config object if the delta values were passed separately.

items.name: scrollTo
items.text:
Scrolls this component to the specified `x` and `y` coordinates.  Only applicable
for {@link #cfg!scrollable #scrollable} components.

items.name: animate
items.text:
true for the default animation or a standard Element
animation config object

items.name: selectText
items.text: Selects text in this field

items.name: start
items.text: The index where the selection should start

items.name: end
items.text: The index where the selection should end (defaults to the text length)

items.name: sequenceFx
items.text:
Ensures that all effects queued after sequenceFx is called on this object are run in sequence. This is the
opposite of {@link #method!syncFx #syncFx}.
this

items.name: setActive
items.text:
This method is called internally by {@link Ext.ZIndexManager} to signal that a floating Component has either been
moved to the top of its zIndex stack, or pushed from the top of its zIndex stack.

If a _Window_ is superceded by another Window, deactivating it hides its shadow.

This method also fires the {@link Ext.Component#event!activate Ext.Component#activate} or
{@link Ext.Component#event!deactivate Ext.Component#deactivate} event depending on which action occurred.

items.name: active
items.text: True to activate the Component, false to deactivate it.

items.name: doFocus
items.text:
When activating, set to true to focus the component;
when deactivating, set to false to avoid returning focus to previous element.

items.name: setActiveError
items.text:
Sets the active error message to the given string. This replaces the entire error message contents with the given
string. Also see {@link #method!setActiveErrors #setActiveErrors} which accepts an Array of messages and formats them according to the
{@link #cfg!activeErrorsTpl #activeErrorsTpl}. Note that this only updates the error message element's text and attributes, you'll
have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends {@link Ext.form.field.Base} you should call {@link Ext.form.field.Base#method!markInvalid Ext.form.field.Base#markInvalid} instead.

items.name: msg
items.text: The error message

items.name: setActiveErrors
items.text:
Set the active error message to an Array of error messages. The messages are formatted into a single message
string using the {@link #cfg!activeErrorsTpl #activeErrorsTpl}. Also see {@link #method!setActiveError #setActiveError} which allows setting the entire error
contents with a single string. Note that this only updates the error message element's text and attributes,
you'll have to call doComponentLayout to actually update the field's layout to match. If the field extends
{@link Ext.form.field.Base} you should call {@link Ext.form.field.Base#method!markInvalid Ext.form.field.Base#markInvalid} instead.

items.name: errors
items.text: The error messages

items.name: setAutoScroll
items.text: Sets the overflow on the content element of the component.

items.name: scroll
items.text: True to allow the Component to auto scroll.
this

items.name: border
items.text:
The border, see {@link #cfg!border #border}. If a falsey value is passed
the border will be removed.

items.name: setBox
items.text: Sets the element's box.

items.name: box
items.text: The box to fill {x, y, width, height}
this

items.name: setConfig
items.text: Sets a single/multiple configuration options.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the property to set, or a set of key value pairs to set.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to set for the name parameter.
this

items.name: setDisabled
items.text: Enable or disable the component.

items.name: disabled
items.text: `true` to disable.

items.name: setDisabledDates
items.text: Replaces any existing disabled dates with new values and refreshes the Date picker.

items.name: disabledDates
items.text:
An array of date strings (see the {@link #cfg!disabledDates #disabledDates} config for details on
supported values) used to disable a pattern of dates.

items.name: setDisabledDays
items.text: Replaces any existing disabled days (by index, 0-6) with new values and refreshes the Date picker.

items.name: disabledDays
items.text:
An array of disabled day indexes. See the {@link #cfg!disabledDays #disabledDays} config for details on
supported values.

items.name: setDock
items.text:
Sets the dock position of this component in its parent panel. Note that this only has effect if this item is part
of the `dockedItems` collection of a parent that has a DockLayout (note that any Panel has a DockLayout by default)

items.name: dock
items.text: The dock position.
this

items.name: setEmptyText
items.text: Sets the default text to place into an empty field

items.name: value
items.text: The {@link #cfg!emptyText #cfg-emptyText} value for this field
this

items.name: setError
items.text: Set the current error state

items.name: error
items.text: The error message to set

items.name: setFieldDefaults
items.text:
Applies a set of default configuration values to this Labelable instance. For each of the properties in the given
object, check if this component hasOwnProperty that config; if not then it's inheriting a default value from its
prototype and we should apply the default value.

items.name: defaults
items.text: The defaults to apply to the object.

items.name: setFieldLabel
items.text: Set the label of this field.

items.name: label
items.text:
The new label. The {@link #cfg!labelSeparator #labelSeparator} will be automatically appended to the label
string.

items.name: setFieldStyle
items.text: Set the {@link #cfg!fieldStyle #fieldStyle} of the {@link #property!inputEl #inputEl}.

items.name: style
items.text: The style(s) to apply. Should be a valid argument to {@link Ext.dom.Element#method!applyStyles Ext.dom.Element#applyStyles}.

items.name: setFlex
items.text:
Sets the flex property of this component. Only applicable when this component is
an item of a box layout

items.name: setHeight
items.text: Sets the height of the component. This method fires the {@link #event!resize #resize} event.

items.name: height
items.text:
The new height to set. This may be one of:

  - A Number specifying the new height in pixels.
  - A String used to set the CSS height style.
  - `{@link undefined}` to leave the height unchanged.
  - `{@link null}` to clear the height.
this

items.name: setHidden
items.text:
Sets the hidden state of this component. This is basically the same as
`{@link #method!setVisible #setVisible}` but the boolean parameter has the opposite meaning.

items.name: setListeners
items.text:
An alias for {@link Ext.util.Observable#method!addListener Ext.util.Observable#addListener}.  In
versions prior to 5.1, {@link #cfg!listeners #listeners} had a generated setter which could
be called to add listeners.  In 5.1 the listeners config is not processed
using the config system and has no generated setter, so this method is
provided for backward compatibility.  The preferred way of adding listeners
is to use the {@link #method!on #on} method.

items.name: listeners
items.text: The listeners

items.name: setLoading
items.text:
This method allows you to show or hide a LoadMask on top of this component.

The mask will be rendered into the element returned by {@link #method!getMaskTarget #getMaskTarget} which for most Components is the Component's
element. See {@link #method!getMaskTarget #getMaskTarget} and {@link #cfg!maskElement #maskElement}.

Most Components will return `{@link null}` indicating that their LoadMask cannot reside inside their element, but must
be rendered into the document body.

{@link Ext.view.Table} however will direct a LoadMask to be rendered into the owning {@link Ext.panel.Table}.

items.name: load
items.text:
True to show the default LoadMask, a config object that will be passed to the
LoadMask constructor, or a message String to show. False to hide the current LoadMask.
